result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Daniel J Durrant

records.addlTxt:
10:11 AM Defendant Daniel J Durrant in court.  Prosecuting attorney Jennifer C Zima in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Court resets so the defendant can get an attorney. Bond is continued. Defendant can appear by telephone at the next hearing.
Arraignment scheduled for November 7, 2022 at 10:00 am.

10:46 AM Defendant Daniel J Durrant in court.  Prosecuting attorney Jennifer C Zima in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Officer Christian is sworn in and testifies. Testifies to being an Officer with the Marshfield Police Department. Testifies to being contacted by a detective in Portage County regarding child abuse allegations. Testifies to a no contact between KLD and the defendant. Testifies to the two being together in the pediatric unit when they weren't supposed to be. Court finds Daniel Durrant is in front of him in the court room.

Attorney Zima requests the court take judicial notice of a Portage County bond that was in effect at the time of this incident. Court grants.
Court finds probable cause to believe a felony was committed and the defendant committed it.
KLD appears in court and wishes to address bond.
KLD makes a statement requesting to drop the no contact condition. Court denies the bond modification request. Bond is continued.
Arraignment scheduled for October 17, 2022 at 10:00 am.
No contact with victim or their residence. $1000
Next Court date to be mailed.  $1000
Preliminary hearing and Arraignment on September 26, 2022 at 10:45 am.
No contact w/victim or their residence
1:46 PM Defendant Daniel J Durrant appeared by video.  Attorney Craig Lambert in court for State of Wisconsin. Atty Lloyd appears special.
